Paper: VisualWikiCurator: Human and Machine Intelligence for Organizing Wiki Content
UML:
sequenceDiagram
    participant H as Human
    participant A as AI

    note over H,A: Data Preparation
    A ->> H: Recommend [content]
    A ->> H: Extract [metadata]

    note over H,A: Visualization
    A ->> H: Update [view]

    note over H,A: Insight Synthesis
    opt Correction
        H ->> A: Correct [entity]
    end
    opt Reorganization
        H ->> A: Reorganize [section]
    end
    A ->> H: Preview [page]
    H ->> A: Commit [changes]
Explanation: The system recommends content and extracts metadata.
The system presents a visualization view to organize wiki content.
The user corrects or restructures, and the system previews the updated page.

Paper: DataDive – Supporting Readers’ Contextualization of Statistical Statements with Data Exploration
UML:
sequenceDiagram
    participant H as Human
    participant A as AI

    note over H,A: Goal Setting
    H ->> A: Select [statement]

    note over H,A: Data Preparation
    A ->> A: Generate [recommendation]

    note over H,A: Visualization
    A ->> H: Present [options]
    H ->> A: Choose [context]
    A ->> A: Match [data]
    A ->> H: Visualize [context]
Explanation: The user selects an interesting statistical statement.
The system generates contextual candidate questions.
The system visualizes contextual data, and the user selects and compares.

Paper: DataTone: Managing Ambiguity in Natural Language Interfaces for Data Visualization
UML:
sequenceDiagram
    participant H as Human
    participant A as AI

    note over H,A: goal setting
    H ->> A: Ask [query]

    note over H,A: visualization
    A ->> A: Parse [spec]
    A ->> A: Generate [visualization]
    A ->> H: Present [widget]

    opt Ambiguity
        note over H,A: insight synthesis
        H ->> A: Correct [constraint]
        A ->> A: Update [model]
    end

    H ->> A: Refine [query]
    A ->> H: Return [visualization]
Explanation: The user issues a query in natural language, text as the main modality.
The AI generates a visualization and exposes ambiguity with GUI widgets.
The user corrects constraints through widgets, combining text and interface.

Paper: Mixed-initiative visual analytics using task-driven recommendations
UML:
sequenceDiagram
    participant H as Human
    participant A as AI

    note over H,A: Goal Setting
    H ->> A: Interact [workspace]

    note over H,A: Insight Synthesis
    A ->> A: Infer [task model]
    A ->> H: Recommend [data, relationships, explanations]

    alt Decision
        H ->> H: Integrate [recommendation into analysis]
    else Ignore
        H ->> A: Refine [workspace organization]
    end
    A ->> H: Provide [new recommendations]
Explanation: The user inputs seeds in a spatial workspace.
The AI infers task models and recommends data and relations, the user integrates or ignores.

Paper: TimeFork: Interactive Prediction of Time Series
UML:
sequenceDiagram
    participant H as Human
    participant A as AI

    note over H,A: Data Preparation
    H ->> A: Provide [data]

    note over H,A: Visualization
    A ->> H: Predict [future]

    note over H,A: Insight Synthesis
    H ->> A: Select [scenario]
    A ->> H: Update [prediction]
    par Alternatives
        H ->> A: Change [assumption]
        A ->> H: Show [prediction]
    end
Explanation: The user provides time series data.
The system predicts the future and displays charts.
The user selects scenarios or modifies assumptions, the system updates predictions.

Paper: Voyager: Exploratory Analysis via Faceted Browsing of Visualization Recommendations
UML:
sequenceDiagram
    participant H as Human
    participant A as AI

    note over H,A: Data Preparation
    H ->> A: Select [variables]

    note over H,A: Visualization
    A ->> H: Recommend [views]
    H ->> A: Browse [gallery]

    note over H,A: Insight Synthesis
    alt Targeted
        H ->> A: Refine [encoding]
        A ->> H: Update [chart]
    else Broad
        H ->> A: Explore [suggestions]
        A ->> H: Expand [coverage]
    end
Explanation: The user selects data variables.
The AI recommends candidate views, presenting a gallery of charts.
The user refines encodings or browses suggestions, the system updates or extends chart coverage.

Paper: Visualization by Demonstration: An Interaction Paradigm for Visual Data Exploration
UML:

    H ->> A: Provide [demonstration]

    note over H,A: Visualization
    A ->> H: Recommend [transformation]

    note over H,A: Insight Synthesis
    opt Refine
        H ->> A: Modify [demonstration]
        A ->> H: Update [recommendation]
    end
    H ->> A: Select [visualization]
Explanation: The user modifies a visualization directly through demonstration.
The system recommends transformations based on demonstrations.
The user refines demonstrations, the system updates recommendations, and selects the final visualization.

Paper: Voyager 2: Augmenting visual analysis with partial view specifications

    end
Explanation: The user provides partial chart specifications.
The system generates wildcard charts and recommends related views.
The user refines or browses related charts, the system updates recommendations.

The system infers a weighting model.

Paper: Managing Messes in Computational Notebooks
UML:

    participant A as AI

    note over H,A: Goal Setting
    H ->> A: Select [result]

    note over H,A: Data Preparation
    A ->> H: Slice [code]

    note over H,A: Insight Synthesis
    H ->> A: Review [history]
    opt Clean
        H ->> A: Remove [cell]
        A ->> H: Update [notebook]
    end
    opt Compare
        H ->> A: Request [version]
        A ->> H: Retrieve [slice]
    end
Explanation: The user selects results to keep or clean.
The AI segments relevant code snippets.
The user reviews history, cleans cells, compares versions, and the AI updates the notebook.

Paper: Visual Analytics for Topic Model Optimization based on User-Steerable Speculative Execution
UML:
sequenceDiagram

    participant A as AI

    note over H,A: Data Preparation

    A ->> A: Build [model]  

    note over H,A: Visualization
    A ->> H: Display [tree]  

    note over H,A: Insight Synthesis
    A ->> H: Request [feedback]  
    alt Quality drop
        A ->> H: Propose [option]  
        H ->> A: Select [option]  
        A ->> H: Preview [effect]  
    end
    H ->> A: Confirm [update]  
    A ->> H: Improve [model]
Explanation: The user sets an initial seed, the AI builds a model.
The AI presents a topic tree view.
The AI proposes optimizations, the user previews and selects, the system updates the model.

Paper: Integrating Prior Knowledge in Mixed-Initiative Social Network Clustering
UML:
sequenceDiagram

    participant A as AI

    note over H,A: Goal Setting

    note over H,A: Data Preparation
    A ->> H: Run [task]
    A ->> H: Rank [table]
    H ->> A: Select [task]

    note over H,A: Visualization
    A ->> H: Show [vis]

    note over H,A: Insight Synthesis

        H ->> A: Accept [goal]

        A ->> H: Suggest [insight]
        H ->> A: Reject [goal]
    end
Explanation: The user provides clustering goals or prior knowledge.
The system runs clustering algorithms and ranks results in tables and text.
The system presents clustering results.
The system recommends extended clusters, the user accepts or rejects, combining text and visualization.

    note over H,A: Data Preparation
    H ->> A: Provide [data]

    note over H,A: Visualization
    A ->> H: Generate [story]

    note over H,A: Insight Synthesis
    opt Clarify
        A ->> H: Ask [question]
        H ->> A: Give [feedback]
        A ->> H: Refine [story]
    end
    opt Repeat
        A ->> H: Ask [question]
        H ->> A: Give [feedback]
        A ->> H: Update [story]
    end
Explanation: The user provides datasets.
The system generates draft stories.
The system collects feedback via Q&A and updates stories.

Paper: LightVA: Lightweight Visual Analytics with LLM Agent-Based Task Planning and Execution
UML:
sequenceDiagram

    participant A as AI

    A ->> A: Execute [visualization & analysis]

    note over H,A: Insight Synthesis

    end

    H ->> A: Refine [task or goal]
Explanation: The user sets analytic goals.
The AI decomposes tasks into subtasks.
The AI performs data analysis and visualization.
The AI presents insights, the user inspects and adjusts tasks, possibly triggering recursive planning.

Explanation: The AI provides model or data explanations with textual and visual dashboards.

The person manipulates models, the AI retrains and outputs updated visual explanations.

Paper: InsigHTable: Insight-driven Hierarchical Table Visualization with Reinforcement Learning

Paper: Improving Steering and Verification in AI-Assisted Data Analysis with Interactive Task DecompositionImproving Steering and Verification in AI-Assisted Data Analysis with Interactive Task Decomposition
UML:
sequenceDiagram
    participant H as Human
    participant A as AI

    note over H,A: Goal Setting
    H ->> A: Submit [analysis task]

    note over H,A: Data Preparation
    alt Conversational
        A ->> H: Provide [full solution]
        H ->> A: Send [follow-up prompts]
    else Stepwise
        A ->> H: Present [editable assumptions + code per step]
        H ->> A: Modify [assumptions or code]
        A ->> H: Generate [next step output]
    else Phasewise
        A ->> H: Present [assumptions, execution plan, code]
        H ->> A: Edit [any phase]
        A ->> H: Update [solution accordingly]
    end

    note over H,A: Insight Synthesis
    H ->> A: Verify [results, correctness]
Explanation: The user submits analytic tasks.
The AI outputs hypotheses and code stepwise or in phases through conversation.
The user inspects and modifies results.
